meanings.definition: Words adopted from one language into another.
meanings.sent1: Many English loanwords come from French.
meanings.sent2: Japanese has many loanwords from English.
meanings.sent3: The class had fun learning about loanwords in Spanish.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was sprinkled with loanwords, adding a touch of sophistication.
meanings.sent5: Learning loanwords can help you understand different cultures better.

meanings.definition: A word borrowed from another language.
meanings.sent1: The term 'sushi' is a loanword from Japanese.
meanings.sent2: In English, 'kindergarten' is a loanword from German.
meanings.sent3: She impresses her friends by casually using loanwords in conversation.
meanings.sent4: The loanword 'karaoke' has become popular worldwide.
meanings.sent5: Using loanwords can make your speech more colorful and interesting.
